WorkItem.Description: Need to remove tomcat from BYU server - check all possible optimizations for the server. Remove geoserver software. Try to make it faster. Reinstall and reconfigure PVMapper. Look for and document any obscurities related to setup.
WorkItem.Summary: Rebuild BYU server for development version of PVMapper

Comments.Message:
I have removed TomCat and GeoServer. Reinstalled IIS. Reinstalled PVMapper. I have a document stating the steps I needed to do before I could get it running perfectly. 

BUT! It is still slow.

I have tried running iis at 32 bit(as was one of the suggestions I found online, to speed up the process), but to no improvement.

You can check out the demo at 
geoserver.byu.edu/pvmapper

And basically any Module that sends out a request to an external server is running really slow.

Okay! After 9 days of work on the server..Hitting my head against the wall working with IIS, The best so far I have got on IIS speeds is this instance : https://geoserver.byu.edu/pvMapper/

I am still tackling the issue to get it running perfectly through IIS but I have exhausted all my options so far, and unless I get divine inspiration, I am at a dead end on though IIS. 

But, Well, some good news. I found another server (Abyss) which has ASP.NET support and runs on Windows pretty well, (compared to MONO for linux, which was another pain to set up). So, we have a much faster dev version set up at https://geoserver.byu.edu:4431/ . Please make sure to accept the certificate. As of now its just a dummy one. But the site works. And much faster than the one through IIS. You can test it out with the username: admin and password: admin1. 

I have contacted a few experts on IIS, even (for the first time) posted on StackOverFlow and am waiting on responses. If something comes along in a few days that works, then Yaaay! Till then I am going to spend my time in perfecting the Abyss server as a tool for development hosting and maybe future deployment as well?
